p: Outside the host, the virus can survive for 4 days in diarrheal stool samples with an alkaline pH [ 202], more than 7 days in respiratory secretions at room temperature, for at least 4 days in undiluted urine, faeces and human serum at room temperature [ 201], up to 9 days in suspension, 60 h in soil/water, more than 1 day on hard surfaces such as glass and metal [ 202], up to 48 h on plastic surfaces [ 205], and 6 days in the dried state [ 202].
